title: You’ve never seen anything like this
caption: You’ve never seen anything like this
desc: This macrophotograph of a snowflake shows the classic, six-sided structure that we’ve all come to associate with this tiny marvel. Until the advent of macro- and micro-photography in the late 1800s, it was impossible to study the structure of snowflakes - they melted too quickly to be accurately sketched under a microscope. Enter Wilson 'Snowflake' Bentley. A farmer and self-trained scientist from Jericho, Vermont, Bentley was the first person to successfully photograph an individual snowflake. Over his lifetime, he would produce over 5,000 different images, a feat that led him to be the first to observe that every snowflake is unique.
